channel.title: Make Money with AI
channel.description: Recent content on Make Money with AI

item.title: Introducing Woz
item.description:
I built an AI assistant called Woz that lives in OpenClaw on my machine. It has access to my code, my projects, my entire workspace. The idea is simple: I handle the decisions that matter, Woz handles everything else.

There’s basically two kinds of work. Thinking work — architecture, decisions, problems that need judgment. And scaffolding work — branches, refactors, tests, docs, the stuff that’s necessary but tedious. I was drowning in scaffolding. Woz fixes that.

item.title: Saving Money on AI Tokens
item.description:
If you’re paying full price for Claude or GPT-4, you’re overpaying. I tested a bunch of alternatives and landed on a simple rule: use the right tool for the job.

For big, complex queries where you need deep reasoning, use GPT-Codex-5.3. The promo pricing is absurd — $25/month or $120/month unlimited. That’s next-gen level AI for basically nothing. I throw my architecture decisions, my large refactors, anything that needs real thought at it.
